channel.title: is autoremove safe?
channel.description:
i regularly keep my system up to date, i am on whonix 15 kvm.
today, in gateway i got "acl" can be removed, do apt autoremove after updating, so i did it. Then i looked up what it was and it is access control list? does this have anything to do with permissions and did i just fuck my system up because of it? does app-armor need it?
same thing in workstation, this time i got "the following packages can be removed, "acl mupdf".
so what is the deal with autoremove? is this safe to do?

item.title: is autoremove safe?
item.dc:creator: Patrick_mobile
item.description:
Whonix – 23 Nov 19

Whonix Debian Packages

Which Whonix ™ Debian packages are safe to remove? What is a meta package? What other packages do Whonix ™ meta packages install? Which packages should never be removed? Why is package X installed?

Read full topic
